mechanics.trigger: Creature attempts to read the script
mechanics.condition: Creature was designated by the caster when the spell was cast
mechanics.outcome: The writing appears normal, in the caster's hand, and conveys the intended meaning

mechanics.trigger: Creature attempts to read the script
mechanics.condition: Creature was NOT designated by the caster when the spell was cast AND the caster did NOT choose an alternative message
mechanics.outcome: The writing appears as an unknown or magical, unintelligible script

mechanics.trigger: Creature attempts to read the script
mechanics.condition: Creature was NOT designated by the caster when the spell was cast AND the caster chose an alternative message AND the alternative language is one the caster knows
mechanics.outcome: The writing appears as an entirely different message, in a different hand and language
The original script and the illusion both disappear

mechanics.trigger: Creature with Truesight attempts to read the script
mechanics.outcome: The creature can read the hidden, true message

description_text: You write on parchment, paper, or some other suitable writing material and imbue it with a potent illusion that lasts for the duration. To you and any creatures you designate when you cast the spell, the writing appears normal, written in your hand, and conveys whatever meaning you intended when you wrote the text. To all others, the writing appears as if it were written in an unknown or magical script that is unintelligible. Alternatively, you can cause the writing to appear to be an entirely different message, written in a different hand and language, though the language must be one you know. Should the spell be dispelled, the original script and the illusion both disappear. A creature with truesight can read the hidden message.
